repnme.cdata!:
Trinidad and Tobago - Youth Training and
            Employment Partnership Project (YTEPP)

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project is considered
            satisfactory. The project sustainability is substantial,
            considering both the government and the private
            sector's interest in the future of the project. Some
            key lessons learned and recommendations follow: 1) important
            factors for project sustainability are the linkages among
            the private industry, the government and public entities, as
            well as coordination with the respective ministry, i.e., for
            the provision or access to facilities, equipment, human
            resources and technical expertise; 2) an institutional
            framework should be in place to ease national policies and
            delineate areas of responsibility; 3) decision making,
            flexibility and creativity are paramount areas in the
            vitality of a successful operation, and a constant
            institutional strengthening provides the likelihood for
            sustainable projects; 4) selection of courses, responding to
            client and industry demands may be better obtained through a
            timely and accurate labor market information; 5) flexibility
            in the cycle schedule and training modules facilitated the
            movement from level to level; 6) evidence suggests that the
            Career Enhancement Program was vital for a successful
            operation, and it should be strengthened in future
            operations; and, 7) the Microenterprise Development Program
            however, hindered success, thus substantial time should be
            allowed for such programs to take off.

repnme.cdata!:
Trinidad and Tobago - Education and
            Training For Youth Employment Project

abstracts.cdata!:
In response to the expansion of
            unemployment especially of youth between the ages of 15-25
            in the recent period of recession, the Government created
            Youth Training and Employment Partnership Program (YTEPP) as
            a temporary program to better prepare, motivate and assist
            youth to enter gainful employment.  The proposed project
            would assist the Government to improve the design, delivery,
            and effectiveness by pursuing four objectives : a) improve
            the quality and relevance of education and training through
            curriculum development, instructor training and provision of
            equipment for training facilities; b) increase opportunities
            for youth to acquire work experience in private enterprises
            or public agencies; c) promote self-employment initiatives
            of youth; and d) strengthen the management of YTEPP Program.
            Project objectives would be attained through three
            components : 1) "education and training" would
            assist YTEPP in improving design of its education and
            training courses, upgrading quality of the teaching staff,
            and providing supplementary instructional equipment; 2)
            "post training assistance" would support, with
            parallel co-financing by the private sector, work experience
            placements for trainees in order to facilitate their first
            entry into labor markets; 3) "program management
            strengthening" would strengthen management of
            YTEPP's training programs, establish project monitoring
            and evaluation systems and support a labor market
            information system.
